lexUnit.name: waltz.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or act lightly, casually, or inconsiderately:

sentence.text: He , after all , found her quite as repulsive as she found him and , as the two of them waltzed from oven to sink , from window to cutlery drawer , staring up , down , sideways , anywhere but at each other , Henry had always assumed that this was no more than the usual politesse of a failed English , suburban marriage .
Northside have taken a trip from the street to the stage without appearing to stop off at the rehearsal room , and display no remorse at waltzing straight into the charts .
` I 'm not used to some bloody apprentice waltzing into my house and asking me about my private affairs -- "
Once again The Smiths waltzed into a situation far in advance of their short-lived career .
She loved fantasising about being his wife , wearing big hats , being chauffeur-driven and waltzing through the door of Number 10 if he got to be Prime Minister .
THE first women Royal Marines recruits have waltzed through the elite corps ' gruelling military training .
Thousands of people are expected to waltz through the factory on the open weekend at the end of the month .
Against Vanuata , Scotland waltzed to 40-0 through tries by Mark Appleson ( 2 ) , Tony Stanger , Derek Turnbull , Gregor Townsend and Andy Nicol , Appleson converting two , Townsend three .
` You waltz out of here , letting your stupid emotions rule your brain , without a thought for me and how I was going to cope without you -- "
At the top end of the Via XXIV Maggio , a blue aerosol script waltzes along an adobi terrace : ` We are Kaos -- Ultras . "
There 's no point in asking to go up there in order to waltz around a bit .
` Nice , nice , very nice " he muttered to himself as athletically he waltzed around the chair , examining Dolly from all angles .

Sydney shut-out : Martin Bayfield got the better of Wallaby John Eales this time , but discovered that there is more to winning line-out ball than being the tallest man on the park as Australia waltzed away 40-15 .
The first day there I noticed all these queens waltzing in and out .
` She thinks she can just waltz in and have her photograph taken now . "
I thought you 'd waltzed off and left him .
` You did n't know that when you waltzed off ! "
And so the Danube waltzes over the Austro Hungarian border , curling through a land rich in culture and home to some very strong wines .
The band struck up another pastiche of Strauss and the tide of skaters waltzed round and round in a hypnotic swirl of hats and feathers .
NICK FALDO knows that but for his Saturday stumble he would have waltzed away with the US PGA title yesterday here at Bellerive .
The game had started well for QPR when England striker Les Ferdinand waltzed in for his 15th goal of the season after three minutes .
With absolutely no respect for Charity 's privacy , Mandy waltzed over to her wardrobe and began rummaging around in it .
I bet they think they can waltz home . "
